reviews.sentence: Perfect mellow Christmas Hotel. this is our fourth year staying at the NIKO SF the weekend before Christmas. the hotel is nice not new but clean and the lobby is chill not chaotic like some other hotels this time of year. the check in was easy and the room was comfortable however the pricing each year seems to go up 25 for the same room. we called the hotel directly to get the best rate which included parking 50 internet pool use and 50 a day dining credit. The location is great for the Union Sq area is 2 blocks away with shopping in all directions. The main reason we stay here is the mellow atmosphere and the indoor pool our kids love. The only downside I had this stay was the bill was incorrect upon check out. the y only included some of the managers package amenities it was corrected in no time. For the location pricing and calm Japanese atmosphere we will most likely be back in 2015.

Nice surprise in San Francisco. I was pleasantly surprised by Hotel Niko. I stayed 4 days on 10th floor. Room was huge by SF standards. Nicer than NYC hotels too for the price paid. It was clean safe. Staff were all nice. I arrived early noon on a Thurs. they let me check in. there is a Starbucks in the lobby lots of Walgrens nearby. I have nothing bad to say. I will stay there again.
Too expensive and charge in every details. To use hotel facilities you have to pay for swimming pool and fitness. Cleanliness a bit walk from BART.

I am disappointed. Bed was very comfortable and it was easy to get a dental kit when I had forgotten toothpaste. Nice complimentary wine when I checked in. My stay at hotel Niko was overall a huge disappointment. This is why. I called and asked for advice on how to get from the airport I was given one option and it turned out to be the worst one. I waited for a shuttle bus for one hour at the airport and could have easily taken the bart instead. The reception needs to have a better idea of the current traffic situation to give guests more options. I asked in reception when I checked in what the rates were for phone calls explaining I was trying to work out whether a call to California would be better from the hotel phone or from my Norwegian cell phone. I was advised that there would be a full list of prices for calls next to the phone in my room. There was not and I ended up with a big phone bill and when I questioned this the receptionist was totally unapologetic. The area by the pool was being renovated and I could not use it. I was not told about this when I checked in. The selection of coffee and tea was poor. Only decaf and one green tea. No creamer. The wall needs paint.
The discount is deceiving. Location was great. Not all that thrilled with very mediocre facility and service and premium rate. Pool was not open and no attempt to compensate with small gestures.
Nice hotel. the bed was super comfortable. Halls were worn out looking.

Very good hotel with a beware of extra costs warning. Great location close to Union Square excellent staff good gym good breakfast comfortable bed and room a very attractive hotel. I did not like having to pay 5760 a day for parking. I did not love the additional 30 a day for breakfast and gym use either but it was not a bad value. In general add on costs like these are annoying at best and appalling at worst like the 60 daily parking fee. it is a bit of a turn off to check into a hotel with a stated daily rate in mind only to learn that the add ons will nearly double your anticipated costs.

Stantard room as narrow as a hallway. The room was so tiny. We had more room to roam in the elevator than in the room. And although this is a 4star hotel all of the 4star amenities must be purchased. Absurd. Aside from the nice front desk the other employees we encountered were very rude. The Chicago White Sox were staying there and they were the employees only concern. Elevators were blocked doors were locked in the interest of keeping things private for them even at the cost of other guests comfort. If you are not a well known athlete probably best not stay here.

friendly. The check in was very quick and the receptionist had a great smile on his face. We then had to take an elevator onto the 21st floor. Our room was big enough with an excellent view over San Francisco. In the morning we watched the sunrise over the bay which was absolutely stunning. The room was very clean offered cooled water and a very comfortable bed. We also had a large shower and a bath tub from which you could watch TV in the mirror. During our stay we enjoyed breakfast in their in house restaurant which offered a large buffet with Japanese and Continental orientation. We only used the second option which included freshly prepared eggs fresh fruits and juices a wide choice in bread and warm dishes like fried potatoes or a sausage dish. The night porter downstairs was very entertaining and made guests laugh. He was also very attentive and always called a taxi to our convenience so that we did not have to get frustrated with them as they were sometimes hard to catch. The hotel has a great location near to the shopping area and dining options.

Good service but poor room facilities. Anzu restaurant very good. Helpful and friendly staff at restaurant and front desk. Concierge very good. Lighting in room very poor. Room size too small even for a single. Poor tea and coffee making facilities. I always felt cold in room.

Clean Well Kept Hotel. The hotel was clean although the pillows were too soft. The staff was very helpful. The concierge was great with booking our tour. The only negative about the hotel is the homeless around the building but given that the entire city is congested with homeless Hotel Niko was far less affected by it than other hotels in the area. The pool was nice and its indoors so the weather was not a factor when using the facilities. Designer shops everywhere near all transportation. Restaurants were ok not too many choices if your on a budget. The pillows were too soft and therefore could not get a good nights rest.

Nice hotel and good location. Location was great. Concierge was fantastic. There was only one fire escape stairs for the entire floor and it is poorly marked in case of an emergency. The lobby was nice but chairs designed for giants and not people under 6 ft tall.

Vacation. Dear Manager This letter is to inform you that we were very happy with your treatment at your facilities during my stay. I could see from day one that the hotel service has a great quality both because of its comfortable and appropriate facilities as well as service and constant concern for our comfort. Thank you especially forMrs pume in reception desk being aware of our requirements.

Hotel was as expected. Hotel was pretty much what we had expected. Was not great value but nothing in San Francisco is. We could walk most places and the hotel facilities we good. Rooms are about to be updated from December April.

Great hotel experience. Every detail was perfect. The concierge was informed and helpful. Having a Starbucks in the lobby was an added bonus. The room was comfy and the bedding was very soft and luxurious. My husband and I really enjoyed our time in this centrally located property.

Lovely Place. Stayed here for a couple of nights for a company event in the area. The hotel is quite nice clean and service is friendly. Amenities are not lacking and the rooms seemed nice and quiet. Easy Lyft from the airport and there is plenty within walking distance from the hotel. I had absolutely stay here again.

Wonderful stay at a wonderful place. Every staff member could pronounce my last name without asking me to say it for them first. The mood of the establishment is incredible. It is both formal and warmly welcoming. I felt at home and private invisible at the same time. Example reading in the lobby on their surprisingly comfy blue sofas I felt as if I was almost completely alone. and the view from the 22nd floor was extraordinary. There was a crusty build up of dirt embedded in the lip of the drain cap and the bathtub. The bathroom and most of the tub itself was sparkling clean. I would not have noticed if I had not closely inspected it while debating if I should soak or shower. I showered.

Good location clean hotel. beware of extra charges. My husband and I stayed for three nights. The room was small but clean and functional. There was a small refrigerator which was nice. We never had a long wait for an elevator despite being there during a busy convention. The biggest disappointment was that we had to pay extra for the gym and pool which was ridiculous considering the premium price we were paying for our room. These amenities are included if you book an imperial level room once again which I find ridiculous when most hotels of this caliber include the gym facilities in the room rate no matter which level you book. There are plenty of other hotels in this price range in the same area that include all these amenities in the room rate.

Peace and quiet and a bit of class downtown. we have stayed in Niko hotels in Japan and they have translated the calm polite efficient service to this one. Spotlessly clean. Great soundproofing for a city centre hotel. Slept really well despite jetlagA really good gym for a hotel and a decent pool. Fantastic location really handy for Powell St BART for links to the airport. Chinatown a 10 minute walk away a couple of minutes to the trolley stopcould not fault it. Would stay here again next time in San Fran.

Good Hotel near Union Square. Room was a bit on the small side location is great 5 minutes from Union Square and with Starbucks in the lobby. Fitness center is top of the shelf with sauna and large pool. UPS store in the main lobby. The bar was really very noisy and the cocktails so so.

Pleasant. Nice rooms. Nice lobby bar. The hotel is fine. A little pricey for what it is but for out of towners it ’s in a central location. It ’s a bit too close to the tenderloin for me one block over is a horrible horrible neighborhood.

Great views great gym and a really good breakfast. This hotel is a good choice I liked the Japanese theme and we had an Imperial room on the 24th floor room 2425. so breakfast was included. The large room had a great view and the separate bathroom toilet and sink area was convenient for a couple. The housekeeping at this hotel were excellent our room was always cleaned even when we only left it for a short time. Also worthy of mention are the morning staff in the restaurant ANZU who were also utterly charming and efficient. Centrally located it is right near the Powell St cable car terminus and BART station so easy to get to and to visit all the sights. I was a bit let down when we asked for an extra hour for the checkout time of 11 am as our flight was an evening one and the older woman at reception said no late check outs which turned out to be false as this was later arranged by someone with a much better customer ethos. The gym is really good with lots of choice of machines and weights and is kept very clean. The pool is also fine for lap swimming but small 10 metres. and shallow. Lovely deck area around it one specifically for guests with pooches. Overall this is a very good hotel for San Francisco and we had a very pleasant stay.
Great location extremely comfortable mattress nice gym pool spa.

Wonderful. Location was great clean facility. Fitness centre was awesome with free filtered water and apples. No Ick factorBreakfast was a complete rip off absolutely not worth the money. We walked out. I got a better breakfast at Starbucks for a few dollars. Very disappointing because I wanted a hearty breakfast meal. The Sauna and Steam room was not working but we still had to pay for our access to the gym area. it is a great fitness facility but very disappointing we could not use it.

Modern hotel in Union Square. Good modern accommodations in the heart of Union Square for 500 night and up. If you can afford it it is a good choice. Top notch entertainment venue is Feinstein at the Niko. We saw a Tony award winning Broadway actress singer during our stay. Comfortable accommodations with city views.

Very good hotel in not so good neighborhood. The hotel is great we had a good sized room on 19th floor with great view well equipped gym too bad no Peloton bikes very nice pool with a little spa might get quite crowded in the evening and sauna in the changing rooms. The personal is very friendly. And Starbucks was on the property. What concerned us was the area. Although close to the Union Square the hotel is on the border of Tenderloin neighborhood considered one of the most dangerous neighborhoods in SF. We did not have any problems however. Just not wander deep in the neighborhood lots of homeless people and take taxi when coming late.
Good hotel. I love Hotel Niko. Great location. Nice facilities on property. It is an Asian oriented hotel which is great for me as I spend a lot of time in Asia.

Nice hotel but gym costs USD25 per day to use. The hotel location is excellent the room is quite modern very clean and well appointed. Good facilities in the room. The restaurant in the hotel was very nice and had good seafood. Room windows were filthy dirty and looked like they had not been cleaned in years. The gym looked fantastic and as a business traveler I use the gym often. Maybe I did not read the fine detail on Bokingcom but I can not understand why it costs USD25 per day to use a gym for 1 hour. The hotel has a large pool and I was told that the gym and pool come together even though I had no intention of using the pool. I think the price of the hotel is already quite expensive and this should include a gym visit if needed. I will not stay here again.

Great stay. It was a wonderful stay. Went there for a conference first time and enjoyed. Rooms are very clean with excellent decor. Lobby was very well decorated and staff is super friendly. It is located very close to union square and bart station therefore very convenient to move around. Everything was more than expected.

Another wonderful stay at the Niko SF. I greatly appreciate and enjoy the great location helpful friendly and professional staff attractive facilities quality amenities comfort and views. I stay at the Niko frequently and always enjoy my visits. The Niko is walking distance to so many of my favorite sites in SF. I have no reason to stay anywhere else.
